Reviews.Title: “Excellent location... clean and comfortable room. What more do you want?”
Reviews.Author: totallyuntamed
Reviews.Content: This hotel is literally across the road (admittedly a busy and wide one) from Amsterdam Centraal. Staff were all friendly , welcoming and helpful. The room was sizeable and scrupuously clean. Breakfast was more than adequate. Would definitely use again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel near the station”
Reviews.Author: Weary_traveller49
Reviews.Content: My 2nd stay here, as I was impressed the first time. Spacious, (esp for Amsterdam!) comfy room both times, with tea and coffee making facilties! (So appreciated by us British!) Varied, fresh and large continental breakfast. Bathroom larger than expected, with heated mirror, (which never gets steamed up.) Only a few minutes walk along from the Central Station, (turn right on leaving the stn, it's across the road, just past an Albert H supermarket, which is handy, but v easy to miss - it's up some rounded steps, so good to know it's there.) The only disadvantage is the stairs. Several to climb to reception (though there is a mini-lift.) Also a few to reach the main lift.

Reviews.Title: “Simply very good - Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: justinchopper
Reviews.Content: Hotel is just opposite Central Station and 10 minutes walk from city centre. Rooms clean but small (anyway you are on vacation! you will not stay in the room) Breakfast is perfect and rates are very good. Enjoy Amsterdam. This hotel has exceeded my expectations. TIP: Do not take a room on the 2nd floor. Ask for ground floor rooms. They are bigger.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location yet still peaceful.”
Reviews.Author: Thelium
Reviews.Content: A nice clean centrally located amsterdam hotel.Literally2mins from central station.Great value for5day stay in a twin room.Only 185â‚¬ each.Was in the low season but in amsterdamthat dont matter.The hotel staff were efficient but not overly friendly.Seems that is the dutch way but no complaints.Breakfast is typical european fare.Cheese,meat and eggs etc. I would reccomend this hotel to anybody going to amsterdam.Just dont get stuck in to the minibar.Tempting but Very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Great Price”
Reviews.Author: zaramcgettigan1
Reviews.Content: This a great value hotel in a great location it situated a short walk from Dam Square and just across the road from central station! Very clean hotel with very friendly staff that were also very helpful! The reception area was full of information on activities and attractions to do and see! Which we found very useful during our stay! Rooms were very spacious, comfortable an clean! Would defiantly stay in this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Julie K
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights and the location was perfect. Right across the road from Central Station and in the heart of the shopping area. There is a lift. The staff were friendly and the rooms very clean. Breakfast was fantastic. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good price”
Reviews.Author: Pawel_EPWR
Reviews.Content: A great value hotel in a central location. Very convenient for the train station and main attractions within Amsterdam. The room itself was extremely clean and comfortable. Breakfast was great and staff was always extremely helpful & friendly. Good value for money in Amsterdam. You have to pay for Wi-Fi, 6 Euros for half day and 10 Euros for full day.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect!!-The1Diva”
Reviews.Author: FeenaM
Reviews.Content: Just rebooked next year at this hotel and wanted to share my experience from earlier this year. My friend and I spent 5 nights in a double room facing Centraal. It was surprisingly large, sunny, and comfortable. If you're a light sleeper or want to sleep late, ask for a room at the back, the trains start early and can clearly hear the announcements. Nice touches include : toiletries, towels changed everyday, fridge so that you can get a few things at the market two doors down, elevator, breakfast is amazing! Lots to choose from. Was even able to leave our key at the front desk so that we wouldn't lose it one night out to the club. Close to all the major tourist sites, and the staff were friendly. I would definitely recommend thsi hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location near the train station”
Reviews.Author: peterling1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 27 -30 May 2011. Hotel is just 200 metres across the right from the Central Train Station of beautiful Amsterdam. You come out of the central station and turn right. It is just 10 min. walk to the attractions such as Anne Frank house, must -visit flower market, pancake shop & Canal boat ride.Very convenient for a 1st timer to Amsterdam. It is nice, clean, and safe. Although small, the rate is very reasonable with good breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “AN EXCELLENT WEEKEND BREAK”
Reviews.Author: David H
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weekend break in Amsterdam and decided to stay at the Multatuli hotel based on previous Trip Advisor recommendations. The hotel is very close to the Centraal Station (5 minute walk), and is within easy walking distance of all of Amsterdam's down-town attractions. Although small, the room was perfectly adequate (we weren't in it much anyway!), the bed was exceptionally comfortable, and it was very quiet (we were able to sleep with the window open and not hear anything). Breakfast was excellent - a wide choice and 'buffet' style meant that we had a good start to each day! We had a first floor room at the back - the stairs are very steep and narrow which may be a problem, and the small room meant that you had to squeeze past the bed to use the wardrobe. not a problem for us, but anyone of limited mobility may wish to ask for a ground floor room.... We left our luggage there all day before catching the train home at no charge. I will definitely stay at the hotel on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Guildmaster
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of Sep 2011. The staff at the hotel were polite, friendly and helpful. The room, was a little on the small side, but as we were on a sightseeing trip it was largely irrelevant as we spent very little time there! The hotel is located about two minutes away from the central station, meaning that there is very little distance to have to carry your bags (if to Amsterdam by train obviously) Breakfast in the hotel was pleasant enough; there was bacon and eggs, a host of cold meats and cheese, plus toast, bread rolls, cereals etc, more than enough to set you up for the day! one negative I can give is that I thought the rates for the rooms were a little pricey, but other than that a reasonable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: fesdie
Reviews.Content: Good location, very clean room, excellent breakfast. After reading the reviews was a little apprehensive but it really was a good hotel and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money..”
Reviews.Author: Hungary_Peace
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel too late and the price was about 165 USD, it is not worth it at all. The hotel room was really small and it seems like a sleazy hotel more than a normal hotel for backpacker, if you get what i mean? It was snowing when we arrived, we shut all the windows to avoid the cold but the room got very hot because the heater seems to be heating up the room too quickly. Therefore we have to open the window but after a few minutes, we could hear melted snow water dripping off the roof and it got really cold again. I guess the hotel needs a little refurbishment with their ventilation and stuff. The only catch for staying in this hotel is it is close to the train station, thats it?

Reviews.Title: “Huge Bed, Close to the Train Station and the center!”
Reviews.Author: PSIQUEFATA
Reviews.Content: It is a nice hotel, near the train station, and the transports, and close to center, surround by a nice supermarket and also restaurants. The room is very large, with a huge bed, television, a bathrom with shower, and itÂ´s clean.The breakfast is good, in continental way, the breakfast lady is very helpful, and sympatique, and also the staff people in general.

Reviews.Title: “Clean comfortable place to stay across the street from the train station”
Reviews.Author: TravelingAmigos
Reviews.Content: Five of us stayed here for one night during a short stay in Amsterdam. It was a bit expensive but very convenient to the train and extremely comfortable. The beds had temperapedic style mattresses and although the rooms were small they were modern and attractive. The staff was very helpful with directions and maps. The breakfast room was nice and the meal quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Room 135 has bed bugs.”
Reviews.Author: lambnmint
Reviews.Content: Room 135 has bed bugs. We stayed in July 2011 at this hotel and both of us got bitten each night. The Hotel is in a great location 5 minutes from the central train station, its got a nice front desk and helpful staff. The rooms are fine, apart from ours had bedbugs, odd layout but any hotel in a old building will be the same. The staff were nice, a little eccentric, but really helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a superb location- Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: tallship87
Reviews.Content: I was initally apprehensive about staying here after reading some of the reviews, but I am extremely glad with my choice now as it was one of the nicest little hotels we have stayed in on a budget. We booked through booking.com and got a cheap rate for 3 nights. Our room didn't have much of a view but the room was clean and comfortable with a lovely ensuite bathroom with bath and shower. The bathroom also had a hairdryer and toiletries provided. I accidently scratched my leg one evening and left a little stain on the bed sheets and was pleasantly surprised to find the full bedcover changed by the next day so an excellent house keeping service. Breakfast was great and had good choice in a buffet style with helpful friendly staff. Be prepared to pay a deposit for the room safe key and an additional charge for wifi which we decided not to opt for. (There's a nice little internet cafe that we found just around the corner at 3 euro per hour which suited our needs fine at a cheaper price). Perfect location across from Central Station and within walking distance of all main attractions- could not have asked for any better location! Would definately recommend this hotel to anyone and we would stay here again if returning to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Would defo stay again”
Reviews.Author: x-missy-d-x
Reviews.Content: Hotel itself was okay bit over priced for the stay ( not to mention the 10 euros daily for wi fi). On arrival front staff were okay but nothing to write about. Room was good, clean, size fair, ample tea &coffee etc, and great to see that shampoo, handwash and shower gel provided free in large bottles. View from room was great.... facing canal & central station and depsite being on the main road was pleasantly suprised that the noise levels were low. Breakfast was ok i suppose although the quality of some of the food was poor i.e tinned fruit. That said the staff were very helpful and friendly and provided a great service. Don't bother with room service as the food is less than sub-standard i.e food cooked in the microwave and cheaper than cheap food items at not so cheap prices i.e slice of pizza was in fact a small round pizza type you get 20 for a Â£1.00 also the soup was actually a nasty cuppa soup.... now don't get me wrong nothing wrong with cuppa soup but this one was like it was 1 packet of soup used to make about 5 cups!!! Oh nearly forgot to mention room service not available 24 hours as stated but from 23:00 to early morning??? The night staff come front of house, come chef, come room service was a young polish guy whom was exceptionally funny and helpful depsite not being the best cook lol Would defo return again and would recommend to anyone looking for a clean hotel to stay in with great views, but don't expect too much in terms of food.

Reviews.Title: “I'm a 3 stars hotel, so don't ask me more”
Reviews.Author: Activetravell3r
Reviews.Content: Just in front of the Central Train station in Amsterdam. Room is small, but clean. It is a 3 stars, so do not have big expectations, hotel match exactly requirements for such a category. Located close to a supermarket, so you can buy and store your food in the fridge of the room. Breakfast is decent, but quality of served food could improve. 10 euro required for WiFi is too much expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Very old”
Reviews.Author: grace_szetokw
Reviews.Content: Room is very old and not very clean. In my room, one light bulb doesn't work. The ceiling is very low, your head can reach ceiling when shower in washroom (if your height is more than 170cm). the only advantage is good location. Sure will not come again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: poppy4411
Reviews.Content: Situated across from central station and the transfer bus stops which is ideal if you are travelling to /from the airport or ferry.The staff are friendly and helpful.We had 2 double bedrooms and both were bigger than we have had before in Amsterdam.The rooms were clean ,well lit with appropriate furniture (T.V,table chair,minibar,wardrobe etc).There was also a kettle,cups and tea and coffee!The bedding was clean and fresh.The bathroom was a good size with nice,clean ,white towels.The breakfast was fine with a reasonable selection of things served in a pleasant dining room.There was plenty of free literature in the foyer .Near to tram stops and canal stops and 2 minutes from Dam square.I would definitely stay here again and would not hesitate to reccommend it to others.It wasn't cheap but then you are in a city so price was comparable to other city hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Does the job for budget trip. Clean, safe and good location”
Reviews.Author: andyclfc
Reviews.Content: nice clean and safe hotel. 5 minutes walk from centraal station and ten mins walk from red light district/coffeeshops etc. nice brekafast and nice staff. happy days. woould definitely stay there again stayed in various budget hotels in the dam and this was much better comapered to soem of the places on the damrak itself. would stay again for sure

Reviews.Title: “Small, clean, great location!”
Reviews.Author: MickAng
Reviews.Content: This hotel is based in the perfect spot!! It's close to everywhere and if you get lost you just follow the central st! I wasn't very impressed with the rooms, very small and view from our window wernt great at all!! But hey what do you get for the price you pay! Didn't wake up for the breakfast but there's a selection of everything! If your looking for a 2-3 night stay in Amsterdam this is a good hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Wardy91
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean, beautiful rooms! receptionists are very friendly and they are very helpful when it comes to finding tourist attractions... would definetly stay there again! also the hotels location is perfect to all tourist attractions such as anne frank house, sex museum and red light district and the shops are just around the corner!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location to explore the city!”
Reviews.Author: PrincessDaniLizzie
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel far too early for check in (10am on a monday morning), staff allowed us to leave our bags in a secure locker for safekeeping so we could get out and explore the city. The location couldnt have been batter, for a 1st visit to Amsterdam we were concerned about getting lost but coming straight out of centraal station and turning right saved us a lot of stress, it was also handy as a reference point when we did wander off, we just followed the signs to the station! The hotel reception was clean and tidy and the lift was a welcome sight after deciding we would take the stairs for a bit of exercise. The room was small and clean and despite the window looking out onto another building it didnt really matter as we were never in there anyway, far too much to see! Bed was clean and comfortable and there was plenty of storage space for a short stay, the bathroom was clean plenty of fresh towells provided daily. Breakfast was fine with friendly staff and plenty of cereal, juice and bread for all. All in all, a great value for money base in an excellent location and in a beautiful place like Amsterdam it was everything we needed it to be.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location and clean”
Reviews.Author: Trvlr1969
Reviews.Content: We arrived from flying all night and our room wasn't ready, but it was right at checkout time. We talked nice were in our room in 20 min. Small room with close twin beds, clean had hairdryer and essentials. Nice for one or two nights. We stayed one night before our cruise. Nice location, about two blocks to the right of Central Train Station. We walked to Anne Frank's house, flower market, red light district and some good restaurants. Canal boats are within walking distance, about 3 blocks. Very close to many sights. Be aware there are steps to get up to the registration desk. Some nice people helped us with heavy luggage. Also steps to negotiate to get to elevator. Bell hop helped us with this. Remember European hotels have small elevators, small stairways, and small rooms. Air conditioned rooms, but only works for an hour at a time. Windows open, but we didn't try those.. Woke up periodically to reset AC. Breakfast included, cereal, cooked eggs, English breakfast and somewhat American too. Was enough to get us to lunch. Good price, great location and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Everything!”
Reviews.Author: iKirsty
Reviews.Content: The Multatuli is in the perfect location right across the road from Centraal Station and a short 5 minute walk from Dam Square, Red light district, Madam Tussards. The rooms are spacious and very clean with comfortable beds. The hotel staff are really friendly and very accommodating the breakfast was lovely with a big choice. I will definitely go back to this hotel and will recommend it to friends

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice location!”
Reviews.Author: NakaNiko
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at this hotel and it was fantastic. Quite close to the main train station and the heart of the city center. The hotel has friendly staff. The room was small but perfectly clean. The beds were a bit too soft but comfortable. The room was also equipped with an air-conditioner which made it quite a pleasant stay. Can't think of anything negative to say about this hotel as we had a perfect stay there. This is, by far, the best hotel (for the price) that I stayed at in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for our purposes”
Reviews.Author: macawell
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in 4 person room, which was compact but fine. Breakfast is very good, Staff pleasant and helpful. Hotel clean and location just across from Centraal Station is a definite plus. Cost seemed good value for money in what we found was an expensive city . From our experience, we could only highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “okay hotel- passable”
Reviews.Author: aroundtheworld24088
Reviews.Content: i have been to amsterdam 3 times and would choose a luxury type hotel if i ever go back.i am not rich at all but amsterdam has a ton of what i call scam you..wreck your trip hotels. .this hotel is passable and everything was okay .i would never stay here again, in 8 days here nothing was to bad . the person cooking breakfast extras should not be doing that job. i am talking about bacon and scrambled eggs etc .they are horrendous undercooked. both times i asked for this they went straight to the garbage after tasting . but the hard boiled eggs ,bread, cold cuts and jam are good .be advised you cannot bring either breakfast or any other food into your room.this insures that if you ever want to eat in your room it has to be room service.what a scam.... ...and do not ever stay at the -season star-its a few blocks away .that place not passable in any way .lots of really really bad hotels in amsterdam pick a hotel with awesome reviews only!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Served its purpose!”
Reviews.Author: Jabrams24
Reviews.Content: I found the beds to be really comfortable and it had all the amenities you really needed. It was annoying to put a down payment on a key to the safe, but whatever. The very large smooshed bug on the wall was a nice touch too. It made the small room look even smaller but whatever. I mean, if you're looking for something fancy, this isn't the place, but if you're looking for a quick stay in a convenient location in Amsterdam, this is the place. They were a little annoying upon check out, like paranoid that we were lying about taking not food from the minibar. Overall, it was just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Warm Welcome, Friendly, Good Food, Clean & Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Beckyboo23
Reviews.Content: I definitely recommend the Multatuli to anyone visiting Amsterdam. Located across the road from central station and 200yrds to the right it is quiet yet 5 minutes walk brings you into the heart of Amsterdam. Staff speak perfect English and even when we arrived at 10am (way too early to check in) it was no trouble to keep our suitcase in a secure locker until later so that we could get on with enjoying our break. Room was Exceptionally clean and the bed was amazingly comfy and large. Full mini bar of small bottles supplied(although the prices were a little high) along with free tea, coffee, sugar, coffee whitener etc. and top ups supplied as soon as we asked. There was a vast choice at breakfast.....Bacon, boiled & scrambled eggs, cereal (good selection of Kellogs), yogurt, fruit salad, sliced bread&baguettes, meat & cheeses ...along with milk, Freshly squeezed orange juice and coffee. When it came to checking out at 11am reception again locked away our suitcase until 6pm for us so that we could make the most of our last day without carrying luggage around.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but only a two star hotel”
Reviews.Author: MommaJacob
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. The hotel was a block from Central Station. An easy walk for everyone. The rooms were clean except the beds did not have a top sheet. We requested top sheets, but they never came. Everything else was good.

Reviews.Title: “â‚¬uro per â‚¬uro the best hotel in town”
Reviews.Author: OstiaPower
Reviews.Content: I am a passionate and frequent Holland visitor. I travel to A'dam 3/4 times a year, and I have experienced the most incredible experiences in hotels over there... (many of you can understand for sure!) I generally look for hotels with a good location and reasonable price, as I will be roaming around the city and no using the room much. A friend and I stayed at Multatuli in Dec. '08, booked 1 week in advance via web. We got a special offer, and paid only â‚¬69/day (per room, not per person) for a double in B&B! The hotel has been duly renovated since the hideous reviews it had in the past years (I guess it has a different management too): room was spacious, clean, minibar was stocked, staff was courteous, and the wi-fi (â‚¬10 I think) was running fine. Moreover, it even has a lift (which is rare in small hotels in the Dam), position is perfect, facing the station and at walking distance from what one goes to Amsterdam for: fun! What can I say more... a group of friends of mine is in A'dam right now, staying at Multatuli!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!, Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MD84
Reviews.Content: First of all amsterdam is very expensive, for example a standard pint of beer is 5 euros (not so bad back in the day, but now when the pound is roughly equal the euro, this is very expensive!). So for the cost of 160 euros each for 4 nights (mid week) was good. The hotel is located within 5 mins from central station (just across the street - just watch out for the crazy cyclists!!!). Clean and modern outside and reception (maybe updated from previous reviews?) Close (well within actually!) the heart of amsterdam. Room was clean, tidy, and spacious (absolutely no rats or bed bugs! - again maybe cleansed since prev reviews). Since the smoking ban ther hotel is no smoking (however next to my room 125, there was a door to a kind of unofficial pattio ,which was left open, where we smoked!) Staff were ok (sometimes a bit cold, but maybe thats the dutch for you?). A few points to mention, the mini bar is moderately expensive (2.50 euro for a mars or soft drink, 3 euro for beer - about a 200-300% mark up from local shops, although some shops were just as expensive for the drinks!), i ended up spending 80 euros on the minibar over a 4 night stay so not that bad - its holiday! Another thing is we wewre only given 1 key for a 3 person bedroom, however we stayed as a group anyway! Just to mention amsterdam in general i found very safe, Lots of police about, even the red light distrit is pleaseantly safe (you WILL be approached by drug dealers - just say no!), i was often by myself at night while i waited for my friends - had no problems wat soever! Overall good hotel, but amsterdam is very expensive, alot worse that london and other major capitals i have visited (madrid is very good!) so start savibg and saty at multatuli!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: chick1709
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by the Multatuli Hotel in Amsterdam. We had booked it on account of it's central location and the Multatuli was the cheapest hotel in the area that didn't have completely shocking reviews. There were 3 of us travelling and we were put in the quad room which we felt was spacious enough for our requirements. The room was clean and well kept. The air conditioning was very efficient, if too efficient at times! But on the hot weekend when we visited, it was very welcome. The only downside was don't try and do too many electrical things at once, we had the TV, hair straighteners and hair dryer on and we blew a fuse twice in one night which was rather embarrassing having to go up a second time to explain that we had no power again. We found the receptionist to be helpful and our bags were put in lockers as we arrived before check in so we could have a look around and return to check in. The breakfast was adequate, generally a continental breakfast with some hot scrambled eggs if you were in time. It was a sufficient way to start the day. All in all, we felt that we had a lovely stay in the Multatuli and we would recommend it to friends and we would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely HORRIBLE.. avoid like the plague!!!”
Reviews.Author: bobbyv75
Reviews.Content: Absolutely lousy hotel...the room was small and dingy and the A/C was giving off such a bad smell that I had to turn it off!! The bed was horrible and it gave a backache after a couple of nights! Bathroom was smelling too, especially the WC. Light was blown in the entrance and did not get repaired throughout our 4-night stay in spite of repeated complaints. Breakfast was just about average with poor and repetitive choice. Service was lousy too.., the receptionist was cold and unhelpful. They never voluntarily give any useful information. Avoid this lousy hotel like the plague!! I paid over Â£90 (Euros 109) per night for a supposedly 3-star hotel that was worse than an average 2-star hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “A wise choice”
Reviews.Author: Harrovian
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay at the Multatuli Hotel partly on account of its convenient location ( just across the road from the station ) and also for the range of facilities on offer. The cost per night, including buffet breakfast and tax, amounted to 93 euros (Â£76). I had booked a single non-smoking room, but since none was available on arrival I was upgraded to a triple room instead. There was a wardrobe with shelves and a safe, a minibar, tea and coffee tray, table and chairs, a TV with BBC1 and BBC 2 included, air-conditioning and best of all an immaculate bathroom with both bath and shower, Sheets and towels were changed daily and the room kept spotlessly clean. Although my room overlooked the main street opposite the station, there was no disturbance from traffic noise throughout my stay. Security is excellent too, since the main outer door automatically locks on exit and you press the buzzer to gain entry. The staff on the front desk were always available, welcoming and friendly and happy to temporarily store all my luggage on the day of departure when I checked out. Another nice touch is the offer of free tea/coffee and a piece of cake in the afternoon or evening. The breakfast room is comfortable and equpped with a plasma TV and aquarium. All in all I could not fault this hotel and would certainly return on a future stay in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “BIG disappointment - ruined holiday.”
Reviews.Author: thechowder
Reviews.Content: Just got back after four incredibly uncomfortable nights in the Multatuli. The big problem was the room, which in my experience would be lucky to be considered two star, not the three star advertised. First of all it was tiny. The room was long and narrow - about six feet wide by about 18 feet max, and it this narrowness that made it less than comfortable (see my comments about the bed further down which will hopefully explain what I mean by this). Into that was crammed a wardrobe with safe, a minibar fridge with a TV and radio alarm clock on top, a small round table and two chairs, and something that I can only call an excuse for a bed. It was no more than about four foot wide - we actually thought it was a large single bed. It was shoved against the wall at one side, with just enough room to walk past at the other (no bedside shelves/cabinets - just a shelf above your head). If you needed to go to the loo in the night you had to climb over your partner, and then try to climb back in and get comfortable enough to sleep. The tea and coffee making facilities were right at the bottom of the bed so that during the night the duvet would rattle cups, saucers and teaspoons if they weren't shifted out of the way, though finding somewhere to put them was a challenge. What's worse, the bed sagged at the edges, so you were either cramped up against your partner or sliding off the edge of the bed. It also had a tendency to slide away from the wall, which left you falling into a hole. And if that wasn't bad enough the wall is coated in some sharply textured white paint. I was left with a bleeding elbow after banging against it while trying, in vain, to get comfortable in the middle of the night. We had stayed in the Multatuli twice before and went back because it was clean, tidy, and very easily accessible (opposite the Central Station). But never again - it's still clean, tidy and of course accessible, but the rooms haven't been refurbished in years, it's very, very tired decor wise, and the room was atrocious for the money and star rating. Admittedly we opted for a smoking room and I suspect their smoking rooms are probably the worst in the hotel - it's the only reason I can think of for this room being so poor. It's no excuse though, we paid the going rate for a three star smoking room and feel totally ripped off. The breakfast was adequate, with the usual array of cheese, cereals and rolls. The coffee was in stay warm pots that didn't seem to do their job that well (lukewarm coffee was all you needed after a night in that bed). The scrambled egg was never the same two days in a row (ranged from cold and watery to fairly tasty, or on one occasion not there at all for about ten minutes, by which time I'd made do with a roll and cheese). There were also mini sausages which were nice and spicy and boiled eggs still in their shell. So overall, the breakfast was little more than something handy, so that you could go down get a bite to eat and then go back to bed to try to catch up on some of the sleep lost due to the bed. We never did though, which impacted on the rest of the holiday as we were constantly tired and not able to properly enjoy the sights and entertainment this fantastic city has to offer. The staff are friendly, and we were allowed to stay in the room until noon on checkout day as our flight wasn't until late that night. The bathroom was small and allowed just enough room for your knees when sitting, but it was spotlessly clean and if combined with a better room would not have been cause for comment either positive or negative - just OK. Wifi broadband can be purchased at about 10 euro a day, or just under 40 for a week. You may be wondering why we stayed in the room and didn't complain. We should have, but by the time we'd tried to sleep in the bed our stuff was already all unpacked and it seemed easier just to put up with it. I'm sorry now we did - never again. I'm also sorry I didn't take any pictures of the room but by the time we'd packed I just wanted to get out. Bottom line, if you're considering staying here I would advise you to make sure you get one of their better rooms. To say we were bitterly disappointed with the one we got is an understatement.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and attentive front desk”
Reviews.Author: ASyed
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a triple room with 3 mates facing the front of the hotel. Stay was for 2 nights mid-week. We were on a tight budget so decided to opt for the triple room with three single beds. There arent many hotels which offer a triple with 3 single beds. There was just enough room between the beds to shuffle through the gap to get into bed but that was OK as we only used the room to crash out in. The rooms were clean and bathroom was clean. A buffet breakfast was included in the price and included hot items such as scrambled eggs, bacon and bolied eggs. There was also the other items you would expect such as toast, cereals, cold meats etc. You could go up as often as you liked so that was a bonus. Staff were attentive and helpful and we found everything was clean. The hotel was booked There is a mini bar and safe which you have to pay a 20 Euro deposit for (refundable on return of the safe key). Nothing extra was charged to leave the baggage behind when we checked out. Maybe because it is off season or maybe because they dropped the charge? Downside: Room doestnt have tea and coffee making facilities. Us UK people know how important tea is! Upside: Hotel was fully booked during our midweek off peak stay so they must be doing something right.

Reviews.Title: “Multatuli is wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: mr_willis
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel a week or so before arriving. It was easy to book, the rooms were very clean and comfortable. Very close to the Central Station. Good walking distance to lots of things. I extended my stay from 1 to 4 nights. The guy at the front desk was really nice and we intend to stay again when we go for our honeymoon! Also, the rooms (stayed in 2 different rooms- a dbl and a triple) were definitely a good size.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: AJY
Reviews.Content: The Multatuli is ideally placed for exploring central Amsterdam, and very convenient for the railway station. Having read other reviews here (after booking), I was a little worried that I might find the place crawling with rats - but fortunately, that wasn't the case. It did feel a bit grubby though with marks and stains on the walls and carpets. My room (a single) was small, but had had decent en-suite facilities and a comfortable bed. The breakfast also deserves mention as being very nice (although it is an extra cost on top of the room). For Â£20-30 (US$40-60) a night, I might have recommended this place - but the price I paid, Â£80 (US$160), felt extortionate. To be fair, though, I was staying for only a single, Friday, night, so may have suffered a weekend surcharge. (I note that it appears to be cheaper mid-week). If you can get a room for a budget price, and you're not looking for luxury, then you'll probably be happy. Otherwise, try elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Sapphoxxx
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through hotels.nl after searching reviews both on here and their website and having had some dubious experience with hotels in Amsterdam before. Location-wise this hotel is fantastic, it's right opposite Centraal Station so no taxi's required from the station and it's right in the heart of Amsterdam, within walking distance to Dam Square, the Red Light District and all the great bars and restaurants. This hotel is clean and fairly comfortable and believe me, I have stayed in a lot worse in Amsterdam. I think the price you pay possibly reflects the location rather than the hotels amenities but in general I thought this hotel was fine for the price. The hotel reception is open, clean and welcoming, the front door is locked and opened only by the hotel staff which makes it really safe once you are inside. There are a few steep steps up the reception area which may pose a problem for those less able as the staff do not have a concierge service, although we did not have a problem. The corridors are narrow which is pretty much the same in every hotel I have stayed in this city and sometimes the corridors smelt of cannabis smoke and although this did not pose a problem for us it may for others. I would suggest though that you will find this in most hotels unless you go to the really expensive upmarket hotels. The bedroom was a little cramped, we had a double on the second floor and there wasnt much room to walk around after the case was put on the floor, the wardrobe was a good size, one half was shelving and the other half was hanging space although there were only 4 hangers so there is a limit to what you can hang up unless you take your own. The bathroom was lovely, very clean and a good size, the shower was excellent and there were clean towels every day. The room was cleaned and the bed remade every day, I could not fault the cleaning staff at all. We never used the breakfast option when we booked as I knew there were loads of nice cafes for breakfast nearby. On the down side, the hotel charge for storing luggage on the day of departure which I think is a bit of a rip-off. It's a standard rate of 5 euros which I think is steep considering we were only leaving our case for 1 hour. On check-out they don't print you out a receipt and I think they may have over-charged us for the mini-bar, their card machine was not working either when we checked out which meant we had to go to find an ATM to get cash before we were able to leave. Luckily we had plenty time before our flight or this may have become a problem. I thought 10 euros for internet access per day was a little steep, although the wireless connection was perfect and we never had any problems at all. We had a room at the back of the hotel (room 243) which was fantastic as there was no noise issues at all. The room was always nice and warm too, but not stuffy. All in all, I think I would go back to this hotel which is a first for me in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!!! Glad we stayed!!”
Reviews.Author: LeaXJac
Reviews.Content: My friend and I have just returned today after a 3 night stay at the Multatuli, and after reading some of the reviews on this website It really freaked me out!! I was so worried after talk of Bedbugs and Rats, and really was dreading it! but as I looked on this website only the night before we went it was too late to do anything about it, but I was worried about nothing and was pleasantly surprised, we had a twin room (125) which was a good size; Two beds, a wardrobe dressing table, a corner table with chair and a sofa chair, plently of room!! The bathroom was great, brilliant shower!! ok so it's not massive but there's usually only one in at a time so I don't really see this as a problem, the room was clean and the beds were made everyday and we always had fresh towels, the TV channels were great, as most things were in english with Dutch subtitles and the Mini Bar was handy, ok so it's not really cheap but you're on holiday!!! And at no point did we see any Rats or Bedbugs, we checked!!! There are steps up to the reception, but only about 6 or 7!! It's a central location and I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone!! Glad we stayed!!

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: thumbelinadream
Reviews.Content: I don't understand some of the fussy reviews on this site, who cares if the bread was a bit dry or the room smells of cannabis (it's Amsterdam what do you expect!). This hotel is in a great location for central station and the staff are friendly (although we didnt need to speak to them throughout our stay anyway). Breakfast is not included in the price unlike most of the other hotels which is a bonus because we knew we would never be up in time. The double room we had was a decent size and had everything you would expect (the power shower was amazing) and it also had air con and an opening window. There's also a good size cable tv with loads of channels that we watched into the early hours. Taking food, drink and weed into the room is not allowed but its easy to sneak in and they didnt say anything to us about it. Theres also a good minibar with snacks if you get the munchies. I would definitely stay here again, you do pay a bit more than other hotels but its a three star and its worth it not to have a hot and stuffy room. Obviously some other guests may have had problems here but our stay here was excellent

Reviews.Title: “Frankly, a bit odd.”
Reviews.Author: sparklymonkeys
Reviews.Content: This hotel, be warned, bares no resemblance whatsoever to the photos on the website. Me and 2 mates went for a girly weekend in a triple room with 3 single beds. We essentially got a cupboard with a double (which I have to say was the smallest double I've ever seen) and a single. The ceilings were bizarre which actually gave it quite a lot of charm and character, unlike the suspicious stains on the carpet. The hotel staff were surly and unhelpful and the stairs were perilous (but so are all the stairs in Amsterdam so we won't hold that against them). We didn't eat at the hotel at all so can't comment but breakfast was very expensive when there are so many nice cafes close by. BUT on the plus side, it was reasonably prices, the bathroom was nice with a good shower and the location is fab. 5 mins walk from the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Does exactly what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: Cloughd
Reviews.Content: Thought it only fair to write a review after using other people's to book a hotel in Dam. You are not going to get any bargains in Amsterdam. Therefore go for Value for money which I think this hotel is. Decent price, few mins walk from Central Station, and about the right distance from where everything goes on at night. The room (124) we stayed in (3 beds) was a good size, no other rooms around it etc. The view wasn't great but you don't go to Dam to sit in your room drinking tea looking out the window. Very clean room, good beds, decent TV but the best feature was the bathroom and shower. Best shower I've had in a hotel, and after a couple of mins you could create your own steam room (great for gettting creases out of shirts!!)

Reviews.Title: “good price for decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: roofer32
Reviews.Content: after reading some reviews after i'd booked i was a little concerned, but with 3 late 30's guys from lancs heading over who were veterans of eastern europe hotels, i just couldnt see it being a problem. the hotel is about 300yds to the right as you emerge from central station and on arrival is clean and what your looking for. the room was clean, modern and the beds very comfertable. the en-suite was defo upto 3 star so no complaints from me. the whole stay was good and apart from 3 beds squeezed in a 2 bed room, i have no complaints at all. staff were friendly and helpfull and it was just a short stroll from the sights and bars. the reports on here about rats and dirty rooms are totally wrong in my oppinion and im 100% sure we didnt stay at the same hotel. i was on the first floor at the front and can only give it a thumbs up as a 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: ElCoburno
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay an extra night in Amsterdam having stayed in the Golden tulip which was then booked out. We booked online and were pleasantly surprised, the lobby looked very well and the staff were helpful although a bit slow (all of them!). When you open the door into the hotel it soon becomes an older style hotel that could pass for a B&B the lift is up a few steps which might not be good for those travelling with kids or people with disabilities. We asked for a smoking room but were not given one, no big deal. The room was small and dark and vbery old fashioned. The fittings were made of that old style plastic / wood that reminds me of my grannies house, also fine but not exactly cutting edge design! Bathrooms looked refurbished which was good. The air con in the room is a box in the wall. The hotel is fine, it is basic just do not expect much. It also costs â‚¬5 to put your bags / cases into a locker after you have checked out, I thought this was a bit odd. Location is great though, would recommend for young singles not really a romantic getaway destination.

Reviews.Title: “"Laid back, Dude"”
Reviews.Author: KevinKeegan
Reviews.Content: Four of us ( two couples) stayed at the Muultatuli in early November, after booking it some months before as we couldnt get in the Bulldog and went for it as last resort as we expect to be out most of the time cruising the street man! I read the reviews just before we wre due to go and it frightened the life out of the wives, what with talk of giant rats & bed buds! As we left it late to change we just went for it and found it spot-on. No rats or bed bugs (as far as i could see for any of us) the rooms were ok and as for the steep steps in the reception, hows about not bringing kids to Amsterdem any way (unless getting your kids stoned is your thing). Again do not worry about going here, its OK! Have fun dudes & dudettes!

Reviews.Title: “I would recommend this hotel no problem”
Reviews.Author: Sox12
Reviews.Content: I am just back from my 2 night stay in Multatuli Hotel. I read all the reviews before my stay and was very sceptical about it. It's amazing what some people complain about!! The hotel is dead central -I went for 2 nights on my hen with 10 other people. Not one of us had any problems whatsoever. Reception is open 24 hours so you can come and go as you please. The owner of this hotel was very pleasant and went out of his way for us. He is there every night. Not once did I see any mice, there was no smell off any carpet. It was pretty cold in Amsterdam but the hotel was warm and the showers were piping hot. Its basic the accommodation but its comfortable and warm. It's ideal for a short city break and across the road from the Central Station. I would have no problems recommending this hotel to anyone who is considering a trip to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “One of my top 5 worst hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: eatingchocolate
Reviews.Content: Just as I'm trying to book a hotel in Amsterdam again, Multatuli Hotel comes up in searches, and the awful experience re-emerges in my head. It was really really awful, the experience is still fresh in my mind after almost 2 years. i'm determined that I won't be back. Never ever. I stayed in a very small single room. Once you entered the room there is a small desk and a wardrobe on your right, the bed is right in front of you (you'll be facing the length of the bed, pillow side on your left), and if you turn left there is the bathroom. At the end of your bed there is a window. The air con is right above the bed. The bathroom smelled of urine. The air con made me cold but there is no way to turn it down, and if you turn it off... it gets worse... there is so much dust in the room that if you turn off the air con, the dust instead of kept on being blown about in the room it settles on you. I could feel dust coming down on my face, my arms, all over me. In the end I couldn't bear it anymore and turn the air con back on. The alternative is to open the window - but being a single female staying - I kept it locked and suffer the cold air con and i could not sleep all night. Because of the small room size, the noise in the corridor is clearly audible. What is the point of renting a room if I couldn't sleep in it?

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: MissLister
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from the Multatuli and I wish I had read this website before I booked the hotel. Firstly the room was tiny, nothing like the photograph on the website. The bed was uncomfortably small and there was a tiny window with shabby curtains. A 'cell' would be a more appropriate title. The coffee shop smell was also lingering in the main entrance. My main gripe is Rats or Rat. I don't know how many because I didn't see one but I most definitely heard one. At 5.30 a.m. my husband and I awoke to an extremely loud rustling noise. I whacked the light on and the noise stopped instantly. There was a paper bag on the floor that had a tiny amount of food in. We looked around the room and saw nothing. Actually I was quite convinced it was a ghost to begin with and I stayed awake in the darkness. About an hour later I heard the noise again. I wanted to book another room as I couldn't bear the thought of another night locked in this rustling cell but my husband refused to pay out more money. As I said, we didn't actually see a rat and I was pretty convinced the room was haunted so we did not say anything to the management. It did cross our minds that it could have been a rat though. I did think it was a little strange paying up front for a hotel? After reading the other comments on here I definitely think the Multatuli has a rodent problem and I for one would never return to it.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: trekka
Reviews.Content: I initially booked this hotel through Hotels.NL and my friend then recommended I check it out on this website, and I was absolutely devastated when I read the other reviews! Bed bugs and rats! If I could have cancelled there and then I would, but we were past the cancel date so we decided to brave it, and just leave if it was bad. Thank goodness it wasn't!!! We arrived in Amsterdam and found the hotel straight away, perfect location! The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful, and the reception area is lovely. There are some steep steps to get into the reception, which might be a problem if you are travelling with children, etc, but fine for us. The room (123) was ok in size and was very clean. There were one or two minor touches that had been overlooked, eg, the bathroom had obviously been recently refurbished and needed an extra coat of paint on the ceiling, one of the lampshades needed replacing and the curtains had come down at the edge, but otherwise a very nice room! Beds were very comfy! lovely matress! And absolutely NO signs of rats or bed bugs (trust me, I checked!!!) I would stay here again if I came back to Amsterdam. I think for the price we paid (100 euros for twin room for 1 night) it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base”
Reviews.Author: KingCanute
Reviews.Content: The Multatuli's location makes it an ideal base for a weekend trip like we had in Amsterdam. It's just across the road from Centraal Station and is within a couple of minutes walk of tram-stops and the like. The hotel is basic but very clean (could do with a lick of paint here and there though) and when you look around the city I think you could easily pay a similar price and end up with a much poorer quality hotel. Breakfast not included and the â‚¬9.50 charge put us off as there are lots of cafes around which are a lot cheaper. We were a group of six and on the whole we were more than satisfied with Multatuli. Would stay there again without hesitation. And if you fancy a night-cap the Cafe Kobalt across the canal is the perfect spot.........we should know

Reviews.Title: “Rats in the rooms”
Reviews.Author: PGSNtraveler
Reviews.Content: I should have read these reviews before deciding to stay at this hotel. I found a good rate over the internet and decided since it was so close to Centrum I'd book it for my wife, one year old son, and I to stay for three nights. The first thing I noticed was that although they advertise an elevator, you have to walk up nearly a flight of stairs to get to to it. Not real baby friendly. Also, you have to pay for your stay in advance, which normally wouldn't bother me, but it turned out to be a problem later...read on. When we got to the room I realized that the rooms looked deceivingly larger on the website I made the booking through. The first night went without much incident, but the floor above us creaked and woke the baby a few times. On the second night we were awakened to the sound of rustling in our trash can at about 2am. When I threw on the light I discovered a rat scurrying away. We wated up for a while to see if it came back and after about an hour we tried to go back to bed. But after about 30 minutes of darkness, the rat came back. My wife couldn't take it and we requested to move rooms. The man on duty was nice enough to give us a larger room on the second floor and appologized for the inconvenience. We moved up to the other room only to discover either the rat had followed us and brought a friend, or that the hotel had a rodent problem. Needless to say, we weren't real interested in spending the third night there and asked to check out later that morning. Unfortunately the manager was not there and the person on duty wasn't trained on making a refund to a credit card, so I had to go back once again to ensure my thrid night was properly refunded. My advice, don't stay at this hotel, or if you're still thinking about it after reading this, at least ask if they've got their rodent problem under control before you do.

Reviews.Title: “not so bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel via the web. I decided to read some reviews the night before i went for my break. I was horrified to read what i did as we have gone to amsterdam for 6 years now and thought i had booked a bit more expensive and better facilities than we were used to i.e. roomservice and ensuite. The reviews were all negative. We decided not to bother just make our minds up oursleves. I am glad we did and I can say our stay was great the rooms were adequate the shower was powerful and clean, lots of hot water. room service was good. No-one bothered us which was good because we were away for a quiet break. We rated this an average hotel for the price and not near as bad as some of the reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in September of 2003. I'm used to small rooms in Amsterdam hotels, so I wasn't bothered by that too much. However, the bedbugs were a different story. I had never seen a bedbug before until I stayed here. I noticed a couple of bugs on the wall after my first night. After checking on the Internet, I confirmed that they were in fact bedbugs. Found some more under my mattress and got the heck out of there. The hotel had a sign saying no food was allowed in the rooms. Likely assuming the bugs were drawn by food and not understanding that they were if fact bedbugs whose food is human blood! Yuck.

Reviews.Title: “Go elsewhere!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I struggled between rating this as 'Terrible' and 'Okay, but some problems' because neither seemed to fit! Still, it'd have to be pretty awful to be 'Terrible' -- yet I wouldn't say it was 'Okay' either. My boyfriend and I stayed for 3 nights over the New Year's holiday 2003-2004 & I'm sure we paid the price considering that time frame in Amsterdam. I can't see how this place would rate any stars at all? The rooms are tiny, you DO have to pay a deposit to even have a remote control for the TV (how weird is that?!)--I guess on the assumption that you want to steal the remote control(?), and every night we slept there--I felt itchy like tiny things biting me from the duvet or bedclothes. While I enjoy a good 'coffeeshop' along with many other tourists while in Amsterdam, I don't expect my hotel to SMELL like a coffeeshop throughout--there's a lot to be said for clean, fresh air!! And I'm talking the lobby, the corridors, the stairs, the elevator, etc. The convenient location & mostly friendly staff that we experienced still did not warrant these major cons for our pricey stay. We will definitely go elsewhere next time!

Reviews.Title: “Great for a short break!”
Reviews.Author: Carolinus
Reviews.Content: We are a group of 4 girls and we stayed here for 3 nights in March 2004. The location was great, couple of mins walk from the station, so easy access to/from the airport plus the trams around town. Easy walking distance to all the 'sights' of Amsterdam and safe to walk at night. We had the only 2 rooms on the top floor which were ideal as we could leave the doors open to chat and drink wine as we got ready to hit the town without bieng disturbed! The hotel was basic but it was clean and the staff were friendly. For a cheap and cheerful short break in an ideal location I would highly recommend it, but if you want 2 rooms ask for the top (3rd) floor....

Reviews.Title: “Go elsewhere if possible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in worse hotels, but there really is nothing about the Multatuli that would make me recommend it for anyone else. Amsterdam is a very expensive city as far as accomodation goes but if you can find another hotel at the same price I'm sure it'd be better. The rooms were very small with paper thin walls. Amsterdam has a great night life so whenever someone would arrive back at the hotel at 2am above us, below us or in any room near to us we'd be woken up and eventually have to go and ask them to talk quitely. Also our room had windows facing the street so there was traffic noise all day long, the owners need to invest in some decent windowframes to minimise the noise, they were dated and wooden. There is no tea/coffee facilities in any of the rooms, I believe you have to pay to use the safe, and if you want to change the channel on your TV you need to go and purchase a remote for ?20 (you get this back but I think it's a bit rude). They also charged us ?2 for each calls that we RECEIVED! The cleaners would burst into our room at least once a day (usually while we were asleep or in a state of undress) even though there was a 'do not disturb' sign on the door EVERY single time! But the worst factor was the staff at the front desk who actually yelled at me and my girlfriend; to enter the hotel you have to ring a bell, be VERY careful that you only ring it once, ring it twice within a 60 second period and you too well get a stern telling off from these extremely rude dutchmen and women. Other than that, lovely, a bargain at ?100 a night. No breakfast included.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Multatuli
HotelInfo.Address: Prins Hendrikkade 12, Amsterdam 1012 TL, The Netherlands
